input.description: XML document conforming to the Connection Details Concept that contains the information required to execute a command via command line.

SessionName The name of the session you want to reset. To determine the name of the session, use the query session command.
SessionID The ID of the session to reset.
Specifies the terminal server containing the session you want to reset. Otherwise, the current terminal server is used.

output.description: XML document consisting of one or more <line> elements that contain the command response. Each <line> element contains an index attribute indicating the order in which the information was returned by the command.
Did the operation Succeed? Valid value: true.

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="yes" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <fat-command> <command os-id="Cisco IOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">show</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Windows XP"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">echo Command not supported on Windows XP.</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Windows Default"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">reset session ${name or id}</xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${server name}')!=0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> /server:${server name}</xsl:text> </xsl:if> </command> <command os-id="Linux"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">/bin/echo "Not Supported"</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="SunOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">/usr/bin/echo "Not Supported"</xsl:text> </command> </fat-command> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description: Enables you to reset (delete) a session from the terminal server.
